content.description: TOP FIVE URBANIZED AREAS: CHINA AND THE UNITED STATES
content.question: China City Population Shanghai 25.6 million Beijing 19.6 million Chongqing 14.8 million Tianjin 13.2 million Guangzhou 12.6 million United States City Population New York City 18.8 million Los Angeles 12.5 million Chicago 8.9 million Houston 6.1 million Dallas-Fort Worth 6.1 million Source: United Nations Compare the largest urbanized-area populations for each country, and then select the following statement that correctly draws a conclusion regarding the pattern in the data.

choices.label: China has a primate city, and the United States follows the rank-size rule.
Neither country follows the rank-size rule.
The United States is closer to following rank-size rule.
Both countries have a primate city.
The United States has a primate city, and China follows the rank-size rule.

content.answer: The United States is closer to following rank-size rule.

unit.text: 6: Cities and Urban Land-Use Patterns and Processes

topic.text: 6.4: The Size and Distribution of Cities

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Compare patterns and trends in maps and in quantitative and geospatial data to draw conclusions.
